Document.Focus: Hump behind the shoulders (Dorsocervical fat pad)

QAPair.Question: What is (are) Hump behind the shoulders (Dorsocervical fat pad) ?
QAPair.Answer: A hump on the upper back between the shoulder blades is an area of fat accumulation on the back of the neck. The medical name of this condition is dorsocervical fat pad.

QAPair.Question: What to do for Hump behind the shoulders (Dorsocervical fat pad) ?
QAPair.Answer: A hump between the shoulder blades by itself is not a sign of a specific condition. Your health care provider must consider this along with other symptoms and test results.

QAPair.Question: What causes Hump behind the shoulders (Dorsocervical fat pad) ?
QAPair.Answer: Causes of dorsocervical fat pad include any of the following: Certain medicines used to treat HIV/AIDS, Long-term use of certain glucocorticoid medicines, including prednisone, dexamethasone, and hydrocortisone, Obesity (usually causes more generalized fat deposition), High level of the hormone cortisol (caused by Cushing syndrome ), Certain genetic disorders that cause unusual fat accumulation, Madelung disease (multiple symmetrical lipomatosis) often associated with excess alcohol intake, Osteoporosis may cause a curvature of the spine in the neck called kyphoscoliosis. This causes an abnormal shape but does not by itself cause excessive fat in the back of the neck.

QAPair.Answer: Make an appointment with your provider if you have an unexplained hump behind the shoulders.
